body: Apart from the small suggestion, this makes sense to me.
Don't like this. Can it be disabled by the user?

@vbickov I pushed another update. The `@keyframes` rule also exists in the variants `@-moz-keyframes` and `@-o-keyframes`, these two variants are now supported also. Would you mind testing either the nightly ([checks page](https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/8053/checks), [direct link](https://github.com/apache/netbeans/suites/32127128462/artifacts/2327699786)) or the extracted `org-netbeans-modules-css-lib.jar` again?

[org-netbeans-modules-css-lib.jar.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18155062/org-netbeans-modules-css-lib.jar.zip)

As far as I can see, I think you only have to move the slider away to hide the preview. But it will not keep this position for the next "find". But all tabs will keep the user slider position until close.
Same issue here with JDK21 and macOS 15.1.1

Guys, seriously, you are developers, how do you expect people to help you, if you don't provide basic information?I suspect, that search is working, you are just not seeing the result, that can be trivially be fixed (by you)

> Should I load the *.svg or the *.png file? When I load *.svg in the dataObject and the multiViewElement, it is not working

SVG support in ImageUtilities, and NetBeans APIs that depend on it, works by automatically substituting ".svg" when you attempt to load a ".png" file. So make sure there is both a PNG file and an SVG file with the same base name, in the same folder (e.g. someFile.png and someFile.svg), and then refer to the PNG path rather than the SVG file path.

(Edit: This also works for the ".gif" extension, not just ".png".)

> > Windows Pro 22H2 (build 19045.5247)
> 
> I am no windows expert but I don't know this particular version. I tried to uninstall NB 24 on win 11 (in virtualbox) and it worked fine for me. (haven't tried NB 23, but the installer didn't change between the two releases)

i repeated the test with NB 23 and it worked too. Installed, launch, close, uninstall.

next I installed both NB 23 and 24 side by side and then uninstalled both again. All worked without problems. Win 11 with latest updates.
Just a question, I also use the zoomIn/zoomOut icon from `org/netbeans/modules/image/zoomOut.gif`. Is this correct or should I copy them over to the new svg module?

> but it don't show me the icon. I have this problem, when the name is the same but I will investigate deeper. Maybe a problem with the new implementation from me?

Not sure; this seems like a layer registration problem rather than an SVG icon loading related problem. The icon shown in your screenshot is the general one for XML files, as you already noticed.

> Just a question, I also use the zoomIn/zoomOut icon from org/netbeans/modules/image/zoomOut.gif. Is this correct or should I copy them over to the new svg module?

I'm not actually sure what the rules are for when a module can access the resource files from another module. I'd suspect you can reference existing icons in modules that your own module has a dependency on, so long as those icons are in a public package of the referenced module.

> Not sure; this seems like a layer registration problem rather than an SVG icon loading related problem. The icon shown in your screenshot is the general one for XML files, as you already noticed.

No this was just the visual representation in my production IDE to show you that they have the same name.

This here is the result in the IDE with the new Module
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6f83d526-c3e1-49a5-86c9-12507d7afab8)

> No this was just the visual representation in my production IDE to show you that they have the same name.

Oh, interesting! Maybe try with just the PNG file present first, and then see if the presence of the SVG file causes the icon to disappear somehow (if the latter, we can debug further).
Just the png was working, my feeling was/is the same name but lemme check this first.

Ok, tested and works for me. I did this:

- check out this PR
- add `is.eager=true` to `project.properties` in `svg` module
- download the svg from https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/7938#issuecomment-2466238882 (icon provided by @eirikbakke )
- placed it in tree as `ide/svg/src/org/netbeans/modules/svg/resources/svgLogo.svg` (this screen is from the unpatched IDE): 
![grafik](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/494cf384-e7fc-494e-b918-4c61303fe8b3)
- build from source
- opened the `svg` module in IDE started with `ant tryme` and got this (this image is from the patched IDE): 
![grafik](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d33c67ce-7407-4448-8d86-f6d22fbe26d2)

To verify that the SVG is actually used, I ran with debug activated and placed a conditional break point in `platform/openide.util.ui/src/org/openide/util/ImageUtilities.java`, line 737, breaking on the condition `n.contains("svgLogo")`. That was matched and the loader code ine line 755 produced an icon.

What I mean is, could it be, that you get a search result and it looks like this:

![grafik](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0570e220-6c7f-421f-81c6-1a5adad0d970)

Then, just pull open the result area:

![grafik](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f0e0f21a-0c97-4bb3-8e69-9e4e5a0f1af2)

I saw this a few times, but currently all instances work as they should.
@matthiasblaesing thx for testing and I will check this out.
@Sampaioa07 thx, it is still clear, what the problem is yes. I just investigate what the solution could be.
OK.... It is possible in the source code of version 20 to remove this rule and put it in version 24 and generate a new exc of version 24. Or I can do this.?

This thing was possible long ago under oracle, that you can create an update for a modue and ship just the updated module. But this is not working anymore and also not what a feature that comes directly as wanted, it is a side effect of this: https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/6741 as @matthiasblaesing alreaad mentioned.

So if you have a look into the files, which is quite small change you see why this happens. And if we change this back, another stuff will break again. So this is not a revert back, it needs to be discussed what we should do with special characters in strings in JS (probably also in all other supported languages). So I guess there is no easy(?) solution for this.

For a quick fix maybe, just ignore "#" in strings?

 * Windows 10 PRO 22H2 completely up to date
 * Netbeans 23 still installed
 * JDK Corretto-23.0.0.37.1 (build 23+37-FR)

Can you check the contents of that `registry.xml` file, and possibly share here?  Might offer a clue to what's going on.

The workaround remains the same - use the community installer - sooner we can move to drop NBI for this last installer the better.

> Still having same issue with

@nicolaken does "still" imply that this happened before to you in previous releases?
Same problem here. Unable to uninstall Netbeans 23, because target component was not found in registry.

The problem happens in all my PCs where the OS is Windows 11 24H2; there are no problems where the OS is Windows 11 23H2. 

The message that appears when I try to install Version 24 in Windows 11 24H2, also appears when I try to uninstall Version 23 on the same PC. On that PC, version 23 was installed while the OS  was still Windows 11 23H2, with no problems.

There are no problems when I uninstall version 23 in Windows 11 23H2.

The solution seems to avoid upgrading Windows 11 to 24H2 or rolling back to version 23H2.

Unfortunately on many PCs that I use, the 24H2 cannot be uninstalled anymore, because the "grace period" after the upgrading has already terminated.

@alexchip64 thanks, I did suspect a recent windows update being the cause for this, since the reports showed up only recently.

I don't get the 24H2 update offered in virtualbox - but this might be due to virtualized hardware compatibility reasons. So I was never able to reproduce this issue.

Ubuntu auto updated me yesterday to from NB23 to NB24. I had what appeared to be the exact same issue of no search results that I could see. I almost rolled back to ND23. Your suggestion of just pulling open the hidden results worked for me. Even after you told me where to look, it look me a bit to figure out where to drag.

this is behavior is shared between all trees. The scrollpane will try to keep the node in the viewport if the selection changes.

The reason why it is more noticeable in the usages window is likely because the nodes can contain longer lines, this pretty much guarantees that the viewport moves if the selection changes.

I can reproduce the same behavior in the projects tree or refactoring preview window etc. I am sure we can come up with something but we have to be careful to not introduce other bugs.

the search results panel probably needs a minimal width set so that it can't completely collapse. Usages/Refactoring doesn't seem to have the same problem - haven't checked the other inspection windows.

> this is newest manjaro. there are other weird things maybe just in netbeans. **menu's not dropping down correctly....**

turns out this remark was a red herring if this issue is just about a panel splitter

No, from 22 to 23 it all went fine.

I confirm that. The graphical search does not work. If you get the text using "show all details button" at least you can see the complete text search output.

Lets see how this works (and if it work well enough). If this turns out to work OK, maybe we need to generalize the approach, and use it in other tests that do `waitScanFinished`.

Thanks for the review!
@steamboatid it is a good feature, but it is not yet in a mergeable state.  Maybe you can work with @s4gh to address the concerns if you want to see this added to the IDE and platform.

is there a way to ignore it inside configuration of netbeans somehow and still works with it ? I have the same issue in my project.

Update: 
I found quick fix to disable the warning, simply go to:
Tools -> Options -> Hints -> PS-4 Autoloader and  uncheck Namespace Declaration
can't reproduce
hm, strange, I also se with 24 copy/paste from other apps(browser, VSC, ...) dosn't work

Test with a clean userdir (`netbeans --userdir <path_to_an_not_yet_existing_directory>`) I bet your configuration became corrupted and that is the reason you are seeing this. You can start also with a complete clean user dir, if you delete the folders `$HOME/.netbeans/VERSION` and `$HOME/.cache/netbeans/VERSION.`

As this is not a general problem, I'll turn this into a discussion.
@petrovic-d assuming rebase & squash

If it's easier, just saving the split position and reuse it could be another way to solve this.  It might seem a minor thing, but doing 30 times scroll+move split bar is really irritating at the end...

yeah, UI persistence for the find-usages splitter needs to be implemented. The search results window https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/7779 does have it but we overlooked it for find-usages https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/7694.
Ok so I did an `ant clean` on my local netbeans repo and I see the svg. Maybe it was a caching problem. I think I'm ready in a couple of days. Thx for your help :)

~temporarily merged https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/8037 into this PR so that we can test everything on JDK 24-ea (chicken-egg problem).~

All tests green: https://github.com/apache/netbeans/actions/runs/12401186185

The only exception are the `platform/masterfs` tests which rely on the SM for read/write counting, those are kept on JDK 17 for now. Those tests already are very JDK version sensitive, remember having to patch them at least once https://github.com/apache/netbeans/commit/f2f8d5a91cfd5e68872a453dfa716a652577056d. Would be good to find other ways to tests this in future. Potentially via JFR IO events or other means.

edit: nb-javac PR is now merged to master, removed staged javac and rebased this PR again

looks good! In past we would have bumped CI to the next major JDK version in this PR since it updates the major javac version. However, we have a chicken-egg problem with the SM removal proposals. (many java tests do also not work if JDK > nb-javac version and we can't bump CI here since it would fail due to required SM removal changes)

I temporarily merged this PR into https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/7928 which allows us to test both PRs fully for the first time on 24-ea and all tests passed which is great.

Thanks for reporting it.

Change CI Job https://github.com/apache/netbeans/actions/runs/12350872504/job/34465121290#logs VSCode Extenstion test on jdk17 is still requiring to install externalcodeformatter plugin. likely by passing it there in command line for run, see [https://productionresultssa16.blob.core.windows.net/actions-results/7757e860-3c26-48ee-bee5-5da233[…]&sr=b&st=2024-12-18T08%3A46%3A58Z&sv=2024-11-04](https://productionresultssa16.blob.core.windows.net/actions-results/7757e860-3c26-48ee-bee5-5da233333ae7/workflow-job-run-5eb8a94b-f29f-5661-e862-46c691ffff8d/logs/job/job-logs.txt?rsct=text%2Fplain&se=2024-12-18T08%3A57%3A03Z&sig=7k0oknmIWsR%2FcDBUuAmpMRHY%2BNEx2CWywzUpoSxwIWM%3D&ske=2024-12-18T19%3A00%3A26Z&skoid=ca7593d4-ee42-46cd-af88-8b886a2f84eb&sks=b&skt=2024-12-18T07%3A00%3A26Z&sktid=398a6654-997b-47e9-b12b-9515b896b4de&skv=2024-11-04&sp=r&spr=https&sr=b&st=2024-12-18T08%3A46%3A58Z&sv=2024-11-04)
```
2024-12-16T10:48:53.5279405Z ##[group]Run cd java/java.lsp.server
2024-12-16T10:48:53.5279944Z [36;1mcd java/java.lsp.server[0m
2024-12-16T10:48:53.5280567Z [36;1mant $OPTS build-vscode-ext -D3rdparty.modules=.*externalcodeformatter.*[0m
```

Thx for the review, I also observed 2 things:
1. as @matthiasblaesing already mentioned, the navigation panel works after changing svg
2. the editor tab popup actions for just the preview has just two actions called editors and split. All others are available for source and history like Close, Close all, Close Others, etc.

If those should work for preview too and I would like to know, a hint would be nice. I tested it while pasting the actions registrations to the MultiViewElement but this didn't worked out.

For problem 1, this is the solution in `ide/image`: https://github.com/apache/netbeans/blob/9d5bc1e080daeac06ce0af3e6f1130003ef91015/ide/image/src/org/netbeans/modules/image/navigation/ImageNavigatorPanel.java#L137-L160

The problem is, that `setNewContent` and `getComponent` race. Normally the former wins and initial view does not happen, because you go out of the `null` check:

https://github.com/apache/netbeans/blob/2e720957f1554063363999ff5d938f1a0e556193/ide/svg/src/org/netbeans/modules/svg/navigation/SvgNavigatorPanel.java#L145-L147

I noticed this only after I removed my breakpoints out of the raced path and only into the "it is broken" regions.

For the actions: I noticed that too in other contexts. You might want to have a look at the implementation of the "History" multiview element, as that is in a similar role, than preview (not an editor, but should do many thing similar to the companion multiview element).
Thx again will check.

really useful feature! We have to watch out for side effects of calling `toString()` though.

The debugger does have "Variable Formatters" which can be configured in the settings. Collections (which can be large) will only print their size by default for example. (but I imagine you are probably planning to do that anyway)

Just want to add that I too have the same problem.  

I installed NB 24, used it a few days and than tried to uninstall NB 23. Exactly the same issue as described in this issue.

Windows version: 23H2 (OS Build 22631.4602)
After testing Netbeans 24 on several computers, the bug is still reproducible.
In general it isn't.  So open a bug report (not feature request) with full details of what aspect is slower and what you're doing at the time.
@shadowfly256 thanks a lot for taking your time and posting such detailed bug report.
NB 24 is out and the proposed fix was integrated. Going to close this issue. If this still happens, please file a new issue with as much details as possible - ideally with a reproducer if possible.

hi @junichi11, would you mind updating the PR titles a bit so that it distinguishes the two PRs (https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/8070) from each other. I think one is about mark occurrences in php the other in JS, right? - looks better in the release notes :) thanks!

Can you describe how to reproduce the problem? I built from master and there it works without any change:

![grafik](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c9b49f9d-33c1-4f08-ba79-9640b32dda73)

So what is different in your case?

The issue was, that multiple rules in breadcrumbs are better readable if there is an additional space between them. In your screenshot it's not.

E.g.

.rule,.rule2
to
.rule, .rule2

Like the issue described.

Ok, I thought your problem was, that the rendering was

```
.rule,
.rule2
```

with only the first one visible. Then I suggest to indeed push this down into the css module as that is a general problem in the structure scanner there. As you can see in my screenshot, the same issue is present in the navigator view. Given the origin of the two trees is the same it is not to surprising.
I intent to merge this next week, sometime before christmas, so if you want to intercept, please do so now.

Somehow the Exceptions say NetBeans even though i made sure to close NetBeans.

As for NetBeans: Widowing NetBeans does not protect it from the bug (at least not for me).
As for VisualVM: Windowing VisualVM does not protect it from the bug. When i select no program to profile, VisualVM does not output anything when i turn the screen off. When i select the test program, or VisualVM as target for the profiler, the following exceptions are generated:
```
SEVERE [global]
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Width (0) and height (0) cannot be <= 0
        at java.desktop/sun.awt.image.SunVolatileImage.<init>(SunVolatileImage.java:75)
```

@sdedic @mbien @neilcsmith-net thank you all for checking/commenting I found the discussions points very helpful.

22 December 2024

I installed version 24 of NetBeans
And then, when I wanted to uninstall version 23, I have exactly the same message and it is impossible to uninstall it properly  :-/

On a Windows 11 24H2

I mean the cause for this is likely that the system (e.g wayland) reports a zero sized screen/frame or creates zero sized images/buffers. However I am more interesting in the defensive programming aspect of it. One exception is fine, but it it causes a loop and pins one core to 100% it would be good to check if we can somehow prevent that.

There is only one stack frame of NB code on the trace - and it doesn't do a lot. However, it looks like it is possible to turn that queue off by changing a property (`TimableEventQueue.install=false`) in `platform/modules/org-netbeans-core.jar#org/netbeans/core/Bundle.properties`. (btw it indeed is `Tim` not `Time`, which was probably a typo)

We should also not run VisualVM and NB at the same time while investigating since both are affected by this issue.
https://github.com/async-profiler/async-profiler
is a nice tool which can profile on the process level. Default output are flame graphs which show active areas.

I would also give the latest update of JDK 23 a try, since not all fixes are backported.

I quickly checked and this should be fixed by the next regular javac update https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/8037 (targets NB25)

link to a dev build in case someone wants to test it https://github.com/apache/netbeans/actions/runs/12447221005/artifacts/2352100555 (link expires in ~7 days)

Please provide a sample project to reproduce the issue.

> Ok, I thought your problem was, that the rendering was
> 
> ```
> .rule,
> .rule2
> ```
> 
> with only the first one visible. Then I suggest to indeed push this down into the css module as that is a general problem in the structure scanner there. As you can see in my screenshot, the same issue is present in the navigator view. Given the origin of the two trees is the same it is not to surprising.

The structure parser delivers the list of rules separated by a linefeed like in the editor view and the breadcrumb module simple removes this linefeed with no addition (displayed as HTML I suppose), hence no space between the rules in the list. The same problem is within the navigator view. 

I am not familiar with the structure scanner. So how should this rule list delivered so that all displaying parts still work. Now it's quite convenient because it's just a string.

So wouldn't it be the easiest way to simply do the same change in the node factory for a css file?

Duplicate: https://github.com/apache/netbeans/issues/8073

See: https://github.com/tenzap/phpunit-simple-example/tree/nb24-issue8082
(branch `nb24-issue8082`)

Launching `composer install` should be sufficient to install phpunit 10.5

For the configuration:
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4741743d-2358-4c14-8bcc-ae0265387dd0)
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ff05d358-163c-4b27-809e-7eb96d15d3a3)

It looks like if I tick "test project using just phpunit", it shouldn't add the `.` to the phpunit command.

Actually the `.` refers to the directory in which phpunit searches test files. For phpunit, if `--test-suffix` is not set, it defaults searching only for files having suffix `Test.php,.phpt`. However, in this project the suffix is `_test.php`, so the `.`  wouldn't find the test files, and that would explain why no groups are found.

BTW, if I tick "use XML configuration", maybe netbeans shouldn't even append the test dir to any phpunit call? I don't know if this makes sense.

I think that if a XML config file is set or if we tick to use just phpunit, the dir should not be set,
Otherwise it should be set to the same dir as the one used when not ticking to use just phpunit.
The '.' just reflects the dir in which to search for tests (see phpunit command line options). If not set it would work according to XML config (either the default one, or the one set by '-c' argument) I suppose.
